If a person cultivates many wholesome deeds, with a pure and sincere mind,
They will attain rebirth in the heavens, as taught by the Sage.
Delighting in giving and loving speech, always in accord with a compassionate mind,
Protecting and caring for all beings, this is the true cause.
Because of their pure mind, it becomes the basis for wholesome dharmas,
Experiencing heavenly bliss, with light emanating from the body.
This light is supreme, continuing without interruption,
Like the world having light, not falling into any danger.

If the mind is well-tamed, upholding the precepts and cultivating various concentrations,
Pure like true gold, one is born in the heavens.
Always giving rise to compassion in one's mind towards all sentient beings,
Not committing the sin of killing, one is born in the heavens.
Dwelling in the world with a pure body, unstained by the dharmas of offenses,
Free from all harm, one is born in the heavens.
Seeing the objects of desire as poison, regarding gold and jewels as grass,
Free from the faults of greed and desire, one is born in the heavens.

Escaping from fear and danger, one is born in the heavens.

Not bound by the noose of women, they attain rebirth in the heavens.
Skillfully freeing themselves from the bonds of desire, like a sword cutting rotten ropes,
Peaceful and free from all fears, they attain rebirth in the heavens.
The power of wisdom is extremely firm and courageous, always single-mindedly seeking the true Dharma,

Moreover, those sentient beings, extensively cultivating their wholesome practices,

Always relying on the true Dharma, they mutually have the ability to help each other.
Some fall from the heavens, some are born in the heavens from other realms,
If one departs from those wholesome actions, one will go to the three evil destinies.
All the wholesome dharmas of tranquility are the fundamental cause of happiness.
Even in dreams, one should not abandon wholesome dharmas.
Wholesome dharmas destroy unwholesome ones, and truth subdues falsehood.
The gods defeat the asuras, and wisdom breaks through ignorance.
Wholesome dharmas are the steps, which the wise ones can ascend and tread upon.
They go to the heavens and experience the most wonderful happiness.
Namely, the seven branches of body and speech, not engaging in killing, stealing, and so forth.
These seven can serve as steps to be reborn in the heavenly realms.
Due to pure karma adorning the body, it is radiant and extremely lovable.
It is just like that bright lamp emanating from one's own body.
Therefore, all heavenly beings take precepts as the basis.
They always give rise to a joyful mind and experience boundless happiness.
The celestial maidens attend upon them, like stars surrounding the moon,
Playing in the heavens, all attained through good causes.
Following one's desires and wishes, attaining without loss,
That bliss always increases, all attained through good causes.
Well cultivating the practice of giving, having compassion for all beings,
Being in accord with the mind of kindness, one attains rebirth in the heavens.
Far from the offense of killing, not harming any beings,
Being in accord with wholesome conduct, one attains rebirth in the heavens.
Far from the fault of taking what is not given, delighting in practicing giving,
Not being stingy with even a little, one attains rebirth in the heavens.
Abandoning sexual misconduct, always relying on the right path,
The mind free from defilements and tranquil, one attains rebirth in the heavens.
Free from the fault of drinking alcohol, the mind not giving rise to confusion,
Not being ridiculed by others, one can be reborn in the heavens.
The gods experience blissful joy, they should not give rise to negligence,
They should seek the bliss of tranquility, that is always peaceful and secure.
Experiencing the wonderful desires of the heavens and the supreme palaces,
Moment by moment, they are impermanent, before long, they will all be exhausted.
Mount Sumeru is extremely lofty and excellent, good karma can surpass it,
Up to the ultimate heavens, without goodness, how can one reach there?
There is no satiation with regard to sense objects, the heavens are even more exceptional,
Due to craving, it increases and grows, by what means can one attain tranquility?
Because of craving, the gods are attached to bliss without rest,
Always burned by the fire of craving, how can they attain bliss?ğŸ”½There are three grades of good deeds, three types are the three causes,

Because you delight in the good Dharma, cultivate giving, patience, and non-harming,
Truly corresponding with the characteristics of practice, you will be reborn in the heavens.
Endowed with excellent adornments, flower garlands, and jeweled necklaces,
Experiencing pleasure in the heavens, all is obtained through good karma.
Moreover, the wonderful pleasures in the heavens, superior, middling, and inferior distinctions,
Such threefold causes, according to the fruits of blessings, manifest.
According to the cultivation of those good practices, the two kinds of rewards are not lost,
Either among humans or gods, one then experiences happiness and pleasure.
You formerly cultivated meritorious karma, well protected the precepts of the seven branches,
Now coming to this heaven, you yourself experience the fruits of pleasure.
There are wonderful lotus ponds, producing cool and fragrant breezes,
In precious and wonderful towers, the gods play together.
The extremely marvelous golden mountain, with lapis lazuli peaks,
The jeweled trees have many flowers and fruits, and the devas play together.
The supreme kÄpÄ«lava forest, with branches and leaves all lush and thriving,

There are also seven jeweled mountains, with rivers flowing around them in four directions,
Gold sand covers the bottom, and the devas play together.
The wonderful fragrance of blue lotus flowers, and the forest of mandÄra flowers,
The birds sing in a wonderful way, and the devas play together.
There are also other superior places, all with jeweled trees and forests,
Palaces adorned with jewels, and the devas play together.
The five kinds of wonderful music, as well as the most excellent singing and dancing,
Having heard it, they are all delighted, and the devas play together.
Precepts are the seeds, giving rise to the fruits of all pleasures,
In the supreme five desires, one enjoys them according to one's wishes.
Supreme, pure, and spotless,ğŸ”½And all the pleasures and happiness,

Together with the heavenly beings, playing and enjoying immeasurable happiness,ğŸ”½Such happiness and its causes,
Are not created by me.
The most supreme and wondrous towers, adorned with various treasures,ğŸ”½Are due to the good causes planted in past lives,

Experiencing the five desires on a vast scale, without giving rise to a mind of attachment,
By being free from the three kinds of bonds, one becomes the heavenly king Åšakra.
If one's mind is straightforward, cultivates concentration to eliminate distraction,
And is reborn in this heavenly realm, it is self-evident due to one's own karma.
Extensively cultivating various wholesome actions, experiencing pleasure that constantly continues,
Realizing the causes one practiced in the past, one now comes to experience these fruits.
Cultivating goodness in this present life, is like planting trees,
Causing it to continue to flourish, such a person is wise.
In whatever place one is born, whether doing good or evil,
Each according to its cause, one receives various retributions.
If a person cultivates good causes, they can be reborn in the heavens,
Creating those unwholesome causes, they will fall into hell.
The foolish person attached to desires abandons good and does evil,
Not fearing the time of death, they harm themselves.
The retribution for good and evil karma grows like seeds,
The foolish person's mind is attached to pleasure, never abandoning it for a moment.
Cultivating the three grades of good karma, observing the seven branches of body and speech,
Liberated from the three poisons, one can be reborn in the heavens.
Not moving towards sensual objects, nor giving rise to praise,
Dwelling in the purity of detachment, one can be reborn in the heavens.
Well cultivating various kinds of giving, treating stingy minds,
Transcending all difficult and dangerous places, one is born in the heavens.
Not harming the lives of sentient beings, always giving rise to love and protection,
Abiding in the mind of tranquil kindness, one is born in the heavens.
Far from taking what is not given, the mind like a raging fire,
Abiding in right thought, one is born in the heavens.
Not defiled by the mud of desire, seeing others' forms like a mother,
Skillfully observing with wisdom, one is born in the heavens.
The mind harboring the fire of a prison, arising from the fuel of the tongue,
This is due to speaking false words, leaving this and being born in the heavens;
Because the tongue lacks truth, pointing to emptiness and speaking of existence.
Leaving deceptive and embellished words, one is born in the heavens.
Always far from that divisive speech, with a kind mind, loving and respecting each other,
Not speaking divisive speech, one can be reborn in the heavens.
Evil speech is like a knife or a stick, the wise should stay far away from it,
Always speaking beautiful and wonderful words, one can be reborn in the heavens.
Well guarding these seven precepts, one can be reborn in the heavens,
The wise should understand, this is what the Buddhas have taught.
Adorned with various good deeds, one can be reborn in the heavens,
If one abandons past practices, one will then have regrets.
In the heavens, there are wonderful vines in the forests, winding and drooping in four directions,
Adorned with beautiful flowers and fragrances, the gods rest beneath them.
If one cultivates various good deeds, one will obtain all kinds of happiness,
Going to the heavens, one will obtain such fruits.
Moreover, those heavenly beings experience three levels of happiness,
Each according to their past karma, they obtain their respective fruits.
The cause and effect are similar, yet one is unwilling to cultivate the cause.
If one thoroughly understands cause and effect, one will obtain a share of happiness.
The excellent and wonderful five sense objects, the gods are born and attached to pleasure,
The foolish person's mind is deluded and false, not aware of the great fear that follows.
Aspiring for the most wonderful sensual pleasures, seeking the most excellent realm,
Not cultivating the cause for the fruit of love, that foolish person's delusion increases.
If one delights in that pleasant fruit, yet does not uphold pure precepts,
It is like a person in darkness, leaving the lamp and seeking light.
Apart from the seed there is no fruit, apart from the lamp how can there be light?
Apart from the precepts one is not born in the heavens, apart from wisdom there is no liberation.
The cause of happiness is attracted by karma, all of it is defiled and turbid,
One should give rise to a determined mind, and seek the stainless happiness.
If a person abandons sensual pleasures, forever cutting off pursuit,
They have no mind of attachment and are good at eliminating the grasping of mine.
In the time it takes to bend and extend one's arm, they are reborn in the Heaven of YÄma,
And the heavenly multitudes vie to welcome them, their bodily radiance always illuminating.
Like Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, adorned with myriad jewels,

The jeweled trees give rise to cool breezes, and birds and deer rely on each other,
Heavenly maidens dwell in red lotuses, and they play and enjoy themselves together.
The marvelous and wonderful jeweled flower garlands, the music and singing to one's satisfaction,
All the gods and goddesses make offerings and pay homage.
The universal light garland, the clear river is delightful,
Hearing the wonderful sounds of the five musical instruments, one realizes the illusory nature of dependent origination.
The immeasurable multitudes of gods all play and enjoy themselves together,
Relying on the causes cultivated in the past, they experience the bliss of the three grades.
For a long time cultivating giving and precepts, with aspiration and mindfulness always firm and solid,
By being endowed with those practices, this person is reborn in that heaven.
Always following the Buddha's words, protecting and caring for all beings,
Abiding peacefully in a tranquil mind, this person is reborn in that heaven.
Being endowed with loving-kindness and patience, eliminating the deep sorrow of the roots of enmity,
With a mind of loving-kindness always in accord, this person is reborn in that heaven.
If a person's mind is tranquil, not attached to the three realms of existence,
By skillfully taming that mind, this person is reborn in that heaven.
Having only one true word, not delighting in much empty talk,
Far removed from what is not beneficial, this person is reborn in that heaven.
Awakening to old age, sickness, and death, fearing the flow and turning of saá¹ƒsÄra,
Delighting in seeking the bliss of quiescence, this person is reborn in that heaven.ğŸ”½Dwelling in mountain valleys, forests, springs,
Graveyards, or under trees,
Deeply cultivating various dhyÄna concentrations, this person is born in that heaven.
Endowed with marvelous eloquence, knowing the right time to expound the Dharma,
Always abandoning evil friends, this person is born in that heaven.
In villages and cities, not going out to observe and enjoy oneself,
Only dwelling in one secluded place, this person is born in that heaven.
Always contemplating one's own body, taking impurity as the basis,
Not abiding for a long time in an instant, this person is born in that heaven.
Well understanding the nature of all dharmas, this dharma abides in the stage of dharmas,
Not attached to that cycle of birth and death, this person is born in that heaven.
Truly understanding all feelings that can give rise to attachment,
The mind does not give rise to fondness, this person is born in that heaven.
Understanding all dharmas as illusory, like a city of gandharvas,
Skillfully subduing one's own mind, this person is born in that heaven.
Up to the aggregates such as form, they are only one empty nature.
Aspiring to seek nirvana, this person is born in that heaven.
To men and women, give rise to the thought of parents,
Equally regard all sentient beings, this person is born in that heaven.
Depart from the evil of divisive speech, delight in speaking loving words,
The mind is always sincere and straightforward, this person is born in that heaven.
Far from the arrogance of the mind, regard the body as if it were tiles and wood,
Contentment and always humble and yielding, this person is born in that heaven.
In the day and night, the mind does not give rise to fatigue,
Delighting in diligently cultivating various wholesome dharmas, this person is born in that heaven.
Departing from agitation, torpor, sleepiness, laziness, and so forth,
The mind always gives rise to distance and separation, this person is born in that heaven.
Due to the distraction of the five faculties, repeatedly grasping various objects,
Using wisdom to skillfully guard, such a person is reborn in that heaven.
Skillfully cultivating the four means of gathering [disciples], clearly understanding the four noble truths,
Endowed with vast knowledge and insight, such a person is reborn in that heaven.
Regarding the causes and effects of suffering, as well as the end of suffering,
All truly understood, such a person is reborn in that heaven.
Even encountering extreme danger, not abandoning the good dharmas,
Because the mind is tranquil, such a person is reborn in that heaven.
Not delighting in exquisite clothing, always wearing coarse woolen garments,
Relying on a pure livelihood to beg for food, such a person is reborn in that heaven.
The mind delights in cultivating meditation, sitting peacefully like decaying wood,
Skillfully cultivating the practice of liberation, such a person is reborn in that heaven.
Whatever food and drink one obtains, whether refined or coarse,
The mind does not give rise to joy or aversion, such a person is reborn in that heaven.
Relying on the earth as a bed, under a tree like a tower,
The mind is always at ease, this person is born in that heaven.
The faculties are always tranquil, not drawn by objects,
Free from the defilements of distraction, this person is born in that heaven.
The eyes observe objects such as forms, understanding their characteristics are all empty,
Thus all are rightly known, this person is born in that heaven.
Whether slandered or praised, hearing it the mind does not move,
Not associated with afflictions, this person is born in that heaven.
Understanding good and bad karma, the retribution received is all certain,
One should cultivate that pure conduct, this person is born in that heaven.
One should abandon faults such as greed, having done so one invites evil retribution,
Always fearing all suffering and distress, this person is born in that heaven.
Such great benefits and advantages then become the cause of that happiness,
One should practice all good deeds, and this person will be reborn in the heavens.
Concentration is the forest of merit, the supreme pure bliss,
Able to lead to enlightenment, like a calf following its mother.
If one newly cultivates the causes of happiness, then it can remove old suffering,
Or if one newly creates the causes of suffering, then it can destroy old happiness.
Like honey smeared on a bitter plant, like poison mixed in a meal,
Because good and evil are mixed together, the sweet taste cannot be obtained.
Happiness does not arise from craving, this happiness is only pure,
Able to enter the path of tranquility, then there is no name of the three poisons.
This happiness has no superior, good in the beginning, middle, and end,
Then in the mind of craving and attachment, it will never arise again.
The foolish person's mind is scattered, unable to understand non-self,
In the realm of suffering and happiness, always seeking that desire and pleasure.
If one is free from desire, one severs the causes of samsara,
By relying on pure karma, one can reach the other shore.
That attachment and love are not happiness, they are associated with greed and anger,
Liberated from the loss of greed and so forth, one attains stainless happiness.
Although one experiences heavenly bliss, one does not give rise to joy,
That good one seeks liberation, and has no attachment to love.
If one is constrained by the bonds of love, entangled and truly not happy,
Reaching the place of non-extinction, this is ultimate happiness.
If happiness arises from desire, it is not the happiness of the wise,
Free from the causes and conditions of desire and love, this is the highest happiness.
Not delighting in the practice of tranquility, far from the solitary place,

If one delights in leaving off desire, then one can escape all suffering,
This bliss is unsurpassed, but fools do not know it.
Well cultivating various dhyÄna concentrations, one can remove mental distraction,
Then one leaves off craving and shame, this bliss is unsurpassed.
The wise one dwelling in the forest, always contemplating tranquility,
Obtaining freedom from that craving mind, the bliss of the gods is difficult to compare with.
All the bliss of the five desires, in the end is not long-lasting,
Not giving rise to craving for them, this bliss is the highest.
If one dwells in the forest, one obtains the highest peace and security,
The causes of all suffering, have craving and desire as their basis,
Being covered by craving, one delights in food, drink, and clothing,
This person then is not able, to sit in meditation in the forest.
Always observe with wisdom, relying on wholesome objects,
Always delight in the forest, cultivating practices free from greed and so forth.
If a person's mind is tranquil, then distraction does not arise,
Always delighting in the forest, one can be free from greedy defilements.
If a person is free from deluded actions, without the faults of the three realms of existence,
Always delighting in the forest, one attains supreme tranquility;
Because the mind is tranquil, then there is no craving or seeking,
Always delighting in the forest, cultivating various meditative absorptions.
In cities and villages, the mind does not give rise to delight,
Only relying on emptiness and seclusion, the mind dwells in quietude.
If a person has wrong thoughts, surrounded by greed and so forth,
Not delighting in dwelling in the forest, by what means can one exhaust the defilements?
If one is close to busyness and noise, then distraction arises,
Therefore, one should stay far away from them, and be praised by others.
One should know that staying in the forest is the supreme pure joy,
Free from greed and other turbid states, the wise always stay close to it.
If one dwells in the forest, the faculties are always delighted,
Even the lord of the Heaven of the Thirty-three cannot compare to this joy.
Always cultivating meditation and concentration, abiding in the pure Dharma,
The gods of the Heaven of YÄma are attached to pleasure and cannot practice it.
If one indulges in the pleasures of the five desires, one always gives rise to suffering and distress,
Covered by delusion and craving, how can that pleasure last long?
Always seeking the wealth of good dharmas, not creating the three evil actions,
One should know that such a person cannot be bound by delusion and craving.
In the good dharmas one cultivates, the mind always gives rise to protection and care,
Having compassion for all sentient beings, enabling them to reach a place of peace and security.
If the mind becomes scattered, wholesome dharmas do not manifest.
Since there is no cause for that goodness, later happiness cannot be obtained.
The wise always observe that all sentient beings in the world
are suffering, empty, and impermanent, and thus do not give rise to craving and attachment.
Delighting in practicing the Dharma of tranquility, diligently seeking the wisdom of the Buddha,
always speaking true words, one can put an end to the suffering of birth and death.
Far from the single dharma of craving, as well as from the two kinds of suffering and pleasure,
penetrating the faults of the three periods of time, this person attains a portion of happiness.
Happy results arise from causes, and having arisen, they immediately diminish.
Those causes of contaminated happiness are not cultivated and do not increase.
Not giving rise to attachment to happiness, this is for the one free from craving,
skillfully crossing over the ocean of the three realms of existence, able to reach the other shore.ğŸ”½Moreover, that contaminated happiness
does not abide for a long time even for a moment,

Not weary of suffering, not giving rise to attachment to pleasure,
Not attached to either, one can enter the path to bodhi.
Fools are attached to pleasure, without the means to escape,
Like seeking oil in sand, it can never be obtained.
The foolish mind is scattered and confused, giving rise to a hundred thousand thoughts,
Constantly creating evil causes, with not a bit of goodness.
If a person needs happiness, they should always rely on the true Dharma,
Those who enjoy practicing non-Dharma will experience all kinds of suffering.
Creating the causes of suffering oneself, how can one see happiness in it?
Suffering and happiness each depend on causes, knowing this, one cultivates all kinds of goodness.
Worldly pleasures are not tranquil, impermanence is powerful and vast,
Being tainted by that attachment is like poison mixed with delicious food.
Relying on the wonderful bliss of good people, one can reach the place of non-extinction,
Free from craving and eliminating afflictions, with no conflicting thoughts of ice and charcoal.
Pleasure arising from female desire is said to be only suffering,
Serving as the seeds of evil, one will fall into evil destinies.
If pleasure later brings suffering, how can it be called pleasure?
Ordinary beings do not understand and themselves experience the retribution of suffering.
Enjoying those desires, one is carried away by time,
Just as the sun does not stay long, and the light also disappears.
If one's mind does not follow the changes of suffering and pleasure,
Without fear or love, this is called being endowed with wisdom.
Experiencing the blessings cultivated in the past, without creating new wholesome actions,
That pleasure will decrease, and great fear will soon arrive.
Moreover, those heavenly beings experience the most wonderful bliss,
This pleasure is not solid and enduring, it will be destroyed by impermanence.
If one does not realize that pleasure is like an illusion, a bubble, or the moon reflected in water,
Then those who are attached to pleasure will have their bodily pleasures all scattered and destroyed.
This great fear in the world, there is no expedient that can avoid it,
The power and speed of the death demon, once gone there is no returning.
Life and happiness, all will be scattered and destroyed,
Dragged by the noose of karma, led to other evil destinies.
The pleasures experienced in the past, how can they be widely described,
Why do those foolish people not give rise to contentment?
The pleasures experienced in the present, mixed with the two aspects of the poison of craving,
They are conditioned and impermanent, all will fall away.
The happiness of the three realms of existence, the wise do not delight in it,
It can intoxicate the gods, how can one be free from distress?
Time does not last long, swiftly passing like a flying lightning bolt,
Those gods attached to pleasure, like fire adding to dry firewood.
All pleasures have passed, one should cultivate various wholesome deeds with the mind,
Do not let there be regret later when life ends.
In hundreds of thousands of lifetimes, enjoying various pleasures,
How long can the foolish dwell?
Where does that pleasure go again?
The foolish are never satisfied with pleasure, like adding fuel to a fire,
Therefore one should abandon it, that pleasure is not ultimate.
Knowing the faults of the five desires, one should be free from craving,
Cultivating meditation to remove distraction, this pleasure is the purest.
If a person is attached to desire, what they obtain is not pleasure,
It can give rise to the causes of saá¹ƒsÄra, like poison mixed with honey.
Therefore, one should always be unfond of the five desires,
They should seek ultimate bliss.
Well-tamed faculties, not disturbed by objects,
Those who possess wisdom, their minds do not follow objects.
Fools have little wisdom, regarding suffering as false happiness,
Giving rise to deluded inversion, they flow through the five destinies.
The wise always praise the supreme bliss of tranquility,
If one delights in sensual pleasures, one will not fear future difficulties.
Future sufferings and afflictions are countered with wisdom,
Because suffering arises from wrongdoing, if one does not commit it, there is no fault.
Due to the mutual dependence of self and others, one encourages each other to stay away from evil,
Being able to rescue in difficulty, this is called a true friend.
Always speaking beneficial words, bringing peace and happiness to self and others,
If one delights in engaging in many evils, they are not true friends.
If one associates with bad friends, it will give rise to suffering and distress,
Relying on wise and good people, one will forever be free from all worries and troubles.
The two kinds of practices they cultivate are called defilement and purity,
Among these two kinds of friends, the wise one should make good choices.
One should stay away from all evil, and specialize in cultivating all good,
Since there are no causes of suffering, one will only obtain the share of happiness.
If one associates with good friends, one will obtain offerings and praise,
If one associates with unwholesome people, one will fall into danger and difficulty.
Stay far away from the arrogance of self, and fear all offenses,
Skillfully uproot all offenses, and remove greed and other faults.
Firmly cultivate all good deeds, and turn away from evil ones,
Increasing the practice of meritorious virtues, and not giving rise to laziness.
Endowed with right views, the mind is at peace and unshakable,
With a courageous and gentle mind, this is called a good friend.
One should know that such a person is rare in the world,
The wise ones should associate with him.
If one avoids bad friends, one will obtain a good reputation,
Thus, one should clearly understand and rely on him to seek liberation.
If a person relies on his family lineage, wealth, and handsome appearance,
Like a drunken elephant running wild, not afraid of deep pits;
His mind is always arrogant, and his faculties are always scattered and distracted,
One should know that such a person is despised by the world.
Not afraid of the suffering retribution in the future, he foolishly commits various offenses,
The causes of the past are difficult to obtain, why does he despise himself?
Although endowed with various meritorious deeds, if he does not cultivate wholesome conduct in the present,
That ignorant fool will again drift and sink in the ocean of suffering.
Their lineage, precious wealth, and other forms of happiness,
All are impermanent, and there is no one who can protect them.
If one possesses that clear wisdom and does not abandon pure precepts,
Seeking to be born in an excellent family, this is good and stable.
One should know that the Dharma of pure precepts is like a cool and deep pool,
Able to leave behind the heat of afflictions, and the mind is always at ease.
Endowed with all excellent practices, one becomes truly wealthy,
In accord with the excellent family, the mind does not give rise to abandonment.
Always associating with the wise, one does not give rise to a low-ranking family,
Diligent in cultivating that merit and wisdom, well-abiding in the excellent family.
If the king practices the right Dharma, the ministers and assistants are all pure,
Well-tamed in controlling the faculties, attaining the protection of the celestial beings.
Always practicing the conduct of forbearance, speaking lovingly without joy or anger,
That king will be revered by the people of the world.
Paying taxes in a timely manner, enjoying according to the true Dharma,
That king, without a greedy mind, will become the lord of the Heaven of YÄma.
Pure, impartial, and without thoughts of enmity or favoritism,
That king, with an impartial mind, will become the lord of the gods.
Not taking away what was given by previous kings,
Not afflicting any beings, he will become the lord of the gods.
Delighting in diligently practicing giving and upholding precepts, always speaking true words,
Viewing all beings equally, he will become the lord of the gods.
Delighting in wise and virtuous people, banishing evil followers,
Protecting the true Dharma, he will become the lord of the gods.
Delighting in loyal and honest ministers, not attached to women,
The mind free from defilements and tranquil, he will become the lord of the gods.
Do not listen to flattery and deceit, but enjoy the words of the upright,
Like the sweetness of nectar, you will become the lord of the gods.
Always enjoy hearing the true Dharma, not attached to worldly treasures,
